text:
Hey
I am looking for an external HubSpot and tableau connector which would transfer data (Sales + Marketing + Service hub) from HubSpot to tableau. The ones on the marketplace do not have enough reviews. Is there something you guys are using that you would recommend?

Hi,   i m trying to use an image inside a module, but i set the image with background-size:cover background-repeat: no-repeat, but it doesn't work. I don't know how to create a module whic has an image(what evere it is) for background and have the possibility to let the marketing changes the image. Is there something you people using to solve this issue? A method to configurate the image of a module as a cover in css?

If I understand you correctly, you want to be able to change the background-image of en element from the page editor, right? One way to do it is something like this:
`<div` 
    `class="element_with_background"` 
    `style="background-image: url({{ module.background_image.src }})"></div>`
And then place the rest of your styling in the css. Might not be the best way to do it but it works at least!
<@U02H6TRLZUZ> Thank you for the help; know i m trying it

<@U02H6TRLZUZ> i have created the module, the field image called "background_image", inserted the code in your tip, but it seems he can't find the img...all of this is to create a module image inside the header of a blog-post
Otherwise i m using this to insert the module {%module "background_image_demo" path="/Ardesia_2021/modules/background_image_demo" label="Immagine Header Blog Post Demo"%}
<@U02H6TRLZUZ> i found the error: a ) in a wrong place. Now is working. Thank you again
I always touch something and i m back to the problem....
Now it  can't find the image
Hi everyone! Is there a room for webhook-related questions?
